column1: Osler-Weber-Rendu syndrome is a disorder of the blood vessels that can cause excessive bleeding.
All of these genes appear to be important for blood vessels to develop properly.

Symptoms of this syndrome include: - Frequent nosebleeds in children - Bleeding in the gastrointestinal tract (GI), including loss of blood in the stool, or dark or black stools - Port wine stain (a type of birthmark) - Seizures or unexplained, small strokes (from bleeding into the brain) - Shortness of breath
